name: Turkey Stock
steps: Put a large pot on medium-high heat
Add in the Turkey Discards (without any liver - liver's gross)
Periodically stir the discards to brown them and to build fond
Continue browning as fond nears burning, then deglaze with Water
Once you've added all the Water, add everything else in
Bring it all to a light simmer, and let go for 8 hours
For the 8 hours of simmering, do the following every 15 minutes
Skim any scum off the top (it's just impurities boiling out)
Add some more Water if it's boiled down significantly
Put two layers of cheese cloth over a fine-mesh strainer
Strain the stock through the cloth/strainer
Store the stock in the fridge for quick use, freeze otherwise
comments: Clear stock is overrated, nothing wrong with cloudy (assuming you use or freeze quickly)
